comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
Thanks for the link - this text is especially relevant: 

"The construction of the current Macquarie Lighthouse was begun in 1881 and the light was first exhibited in 1883...With the commencement of the new light, the lantern was removed from the old tower but the structure itself was not demolished for several years."

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: The original Greenway building was demolished by 1887. So I guess this gives us a date somewhere between 1883-1887 for this image. www.dictionaryofsydney.org/entry/macquarie_lighthouse -AG

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] Hmmm, imho no! The date has to be 1883, because "the lantern was removed from the old tower ... " (see quote above). I take this to mean the lamp and the glass windows, otherwise there would be a blind spot due east and confusing reflections from the windows. See this slightly later photo, when the new lighthouse was fully operational - Because the people are the same, it implies that the old lantern was demolished when this wonderful photo from the old to the new lighthouse was taken. - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/4312847312/]

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
Hmmm - when they said "the lantern was removed from the old tower" I was thinking of a light inside the glass dome - not the whole thing!!! But I bow to your greater lighthouse operation knowledge! 
1883 it must be.
- AG

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] It is wise to bow down before The Beachcomber! :)

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Oh golly, now I am all embarrassed - sometimes I must seem to be an arrogant know-all,  but I am not an expert in anything!
